intro: Plesiatropha paniculata subsp. occidentalis, commonly known as the western panicled plesiatropha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of western North America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to various arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought tolerance. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
